Package aima.core.search.informed

Class AStarSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • aima.core.search.framework.PrioritySearch
      • aima.core.search.informed.BestFirstSearch
        • aima.core.search.informed.AStarSearch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SearchForActions, SearchForStates
    public class AStarSearch
extends BestFirstSearch
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 93.

    The most widely known form of best-first search is called A* Search (pronounced "A-star search"). It evaluates nodes by combining g(n), the cost to reach the node, and h(n), the cost to get from the node to the goal:
    f(n) = g(n) + h(n).

    Since g(n) gives the path cost from the start node to node n, and h(n) is the estimated cost of the cheapest path from n to the goal, we have
    f(n) = estimated cost of the cheapest solution through n.
    Author:
    Ravi Mohan, Mike Stampone, Ruediger Lunde

      Constructs an A* search from a specified search space exploration strategy and a heuristic function.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AStarSearch

        public AStarSearch​(QueueSearch impl,
                   HeuristicFunction hf)
        Constructs an A* search from a specified search space exploration strategy and a heuristic function.
        Parameters:
        impl - a search space exploration strategy (e.g. TreeSearch, GraphSearch).
        hf - a heuristic function h(n), which estimates the cost of the cheapest path from the state at node n to a goal state.
